New Records: Shreyas Iyer scored 82 runs from 56 balls, including six sixes, the highest score in the match.
Mohammed Shami took 5 wickets for 14 runs, the most economical five-wicket haul in the tournament.
Virat Kohli scored 88 runs, the highest individual score for India in the match.
Key Match Events: India won by 302 runs, their highest margin of victory in the World Cup.
Sri Lanka were all out for 55, their lowest score in the tournament.
Mohammed Shami became the fastest bowler to take 50 World Cup wickets in just 34 matches.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka won the toss and chose to bowl.
India's batting order, including Virat Kohli and Shubman Gill, was expected to dominate.
Sri Lanka's bowling attack, led by Dilshan Madushanka, was seen as their key strength.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma praised the team's clinical performance and individual efforts.
Kusal Mendis expressed disappointment with the team's performance but remained confident for the future.
Mohammed Shami was named Player of the Match for his exceptional bowling display.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played under clear conditions, with no significant interruptions.
The result secured India's place in the semi-finals of the World Cup.
Others: The Bharat Army celebrated the win with fan banners and social media posts.
The match was the seventh time India had won by a margin of 300 runs or more in ODIs.
